clinical_study.official_title: Smartband/Smartphone-based Automatic Smoking Detection and Real Time Mindfulness Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: To determine treatment fidelity for a smartband/smartphone-based smoking monitoring, notification and brief mindfulness intervention.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will test the feasibility of using a smartband to detect and track smoking and deliver brief smoking cessation interventions by smartphone app in real time. Smokers will wear a smartband to detect and notify them of smoking for 21 days and obtain individual smoking profiles; detected smoking will then trigger a "mindful smoking" exercise for the next 7 days leading up to their quit date at 30 days; after which another mindfulness exercise ("RAIN": recognize, accept, investigate and note cravings rather than smoke) will be delivered prior to each predicted smoking episode according to their individual smoking profile for 30 days post-quit.

primary_outcome.description: Percent of smoking episodes detected and the rate of false alarms in the first 21 days of the study during which smokers are wearing the smartband to monitor, detect and notify them of smoking episodes.

primary_outcome.measure: Fidelity of delivering mindfulness exercises triggered by smoking
primary_outcome.description: Percent of mindful smoking exercises correctly triggered by detected smoking episodes and the rate of false alarms in the next 7 days of the study during which any detected and confirmed smoking event triggers the mindful smoking exercise.

Percent of participants and score range (very low, low, moderate, high, very high), with feasibility determined by 75% of participants rating timeliness of RAIN exercise as moderate or higher (via real-time ecological momentary assessment).
Percent of time spent wearing the smartband

primary_outcome.measure: Adherence to answering smartband notifications of smoking events
Adherence to answering ecological momentary assessment items
primary_outcome.description: Percent of ecological momentary assessment (EMA) ratings (e.g., timeliness, helpfulness, craving, affect) answered.
Percent of mindfulness exercises (RAIN, mindful smoking) completed

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of intervention - helpfulness of mindfulness exercises
primary_outcome.description: Percent of participants and score range (very low, low, moderate, high, very high), with feasibility determined by 75% of participants rating helpfulness as moderate or higher.

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of intervention - user experiences survey
primary_outcome.description: Feedback on user experiences survey (e.g., whether there were too many or not enough interventions) - One survey

secondary_outcome.description: As a secondary aim we will also evaluate self-reported one-week point prevalence abstinence from smoking.

arm_group.description: This study involves wearing a smartband to monitor, record and notify smokers of smoking events and deliver real-time brief mindfulness exercises by smartphone app.

intervention.intervention_name: Smartband automatic smoking detection and brief mindfulness interventions
intervention.description: Smartband/smartphone based automatic smoking monitoring, notification and real-time brief mindfulness interventions
